reviewText: this  documentary film is shot with a cellphone and you cant see whats going on it looks like when you have cable and there is a puzzle effect on tv blurred and very slow moving why slow moving ? why blurred this is the whole film not some of it very bad belive me you won't know whats going on

This so-called movie looked like a Mondrian after the artist tripped on acid. I thought something was wrong with my DVD player at first. I should have read the reviews before purchasing this piece of "artistic" garbage. You get nothing but pixilating dancing colors that could make you go blind along with a droning and sometimes inaudible narration over the whole thing. This should not even be listed on Amazon. I bought the DVD because of the director and a couple of the actors. The pictures on the front and back can't even be seen in this so-called movie since it was filmed on a cell phone!
Dont waste your money. Has to be the worst movie I have ever seen. Its filmed on a cell phone camera and all the images are blurry.
INTERESTING NOSTALGIC FILM.  REASON FOR PURCHASING IT WAS A PERSONAL REASON, AND I'M GLAD I GOT THE CHANCE TO VIEW IT

I purchased this out of curiosity.  I should have followed the advice in the other review and saved my money.  It is a piece of crap.  Most of the time I had no idea what I was seeing.  And the narration became very quickly very tiresome.

A total waste of time and money.  I gave it one star only because I wasn't able to give it none.

very disappointing movie.  i don't think even with a magic wand anyone
can make any sense out of this movie. everything is digitised and i
couldn't make a thing out during 90% of movie
  NOT WORTH YOUR MONEY
after  ANOYMOUS,  all if todd's work has been somewhat disappointing
